intro: Mallotus palauensis, commonly known as the Palau hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Palau in the western Pacific. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Mallotus palauensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for local wildlife.
